reviewText: My grandson is 7 with special needs and he still loves Barney!! I don't think Barney will ever go out of style for him!
My 2 and 4 yr old love it. I like that they use real fireman. It is a little cheesy but my kids love it.
This is a good one.  It is a whole segment like a movie.  Barney and the gang go to the firestation.  They ride on a firetruck.  They go over fire safety.  It's good!

My 2 1/2 year old will watch this over and over. He sings the songs and talks about the firemen. Most importantly, it teaches him to be cautious of doing things that could cause a fire, like playing with matches.
The DVD will auto play, there is no advertising in the beginning so I don't have to stand for 5 minutes before I can start it, like the Sesame Street ones.
This is nearly an hour long, not 30 minutes like most. For me that's great because I don't have to start it over before he falls asleep. Well worth the price.
Great movie for entertainment and teaches the kids about fire safety too.
Great

I have a very busy 2.5 year old little boy. He hasn't ever sat still for a show but loves this video. I'm so glad it's on prime because we have watched it probably 30x in the last 2 weeks. The songs are catchy and the story is cute. And this mama is happy for the little breaks that come while watching Barney goes to the Firehouse.

My son loves this episode of Barney. If I want him quiet for at least an hour this is the show. He watched it while on a three hour road trip and did pretty well for his first road trip. No complaints here.

From my 2 years olds perspective this and Barney goes to the farm are awesome! He sings and dances along with the video. I also like these shows for him.

These Barney videos have values and aspects from the past that many present days shows do not. The images are not as fast moving as other shows.  Both of my kids have learned a lot about fire safety from watching. While is isn't the most intellectually challenging it is not fluff tv like other shows and there are lessons learned. The kids in Barney are nice to each other and teach kindness. My 2 year old also sings the songs while he plays. It is sweet.

My son LOVES this movie!  He has of recent become a huge Barney fan.  He would watch this on Netflix and ask for it all the time, he is 15 months old.  For whatever reason, after my son watching it for a couple of weeks it is no longer on Netflix and he is too young to understand that so he keep asking and asking for it.  I bought it on amazon for him and the price was great.  I was unable to find it at Target or Walmart and as usual amazon helped this mommy out!  I am not a Barney fan, haha, but it is a great DVD to have around for my son!

My 2 and 4 year old children love this show.  The like singing the songs, dancing and learning, too. I highly recommend it.
My autistic nephew loves Barney, when Internet is out we have these DVDs  as back up. Bernie is very educational and very stimulating also.
I rented for my nephew who loved it! He loved watching over and over.  I would rent again for him.
kids love big fire trucks and barney why not put them together? this is fun and educational at the same time.
I'm not a barney fan, normally, but this was not too bad. My grand kids wanted to watch it and I didn't find it unappealing!

The video has some catchy songs and talks about different types of jobs that involve helping people.  Although the video does contain some segments about firemen and fire trucks, it is not solely focused on firefighting, as suggested by the title.  However, my 18 month old does enjoy the video, and I catch his 3 year old sister peeking at it, too!
My son watched his repeatedly.  If your kid likes firetrucks/firemen, this show is great.  It has trucks, fire safety and a visit to the fire house.
Thoroughly entertaining and we talk about it even when we are no longer watching it.  We dance and sing right along with Barney!
This is the current FAVORITE... lots of fire trucks in our house right now, and this just keeps us from hunting the tv for some to watch.

My daughter loved this DVD! She's 3-years-old, and I thought she was over the Barney phase, but she came to me with her Kindle (she has her own, with parental controls) asking if she could buy this movie. I said yes, and she immediately sat down to watch it! It kept her quiet and occupied for a full 50 minutes - no easy feat! She proceeded to watch it again later on that day, so she must have really enjoyed it the first time!

As much as the big purple guy can be annoying to us adults, he does teach the little ones quite a bit - manners, letters, numbers, animals, you name it! I'm glad I invested in the Barney movies after all.
